description: From Old French configurer, from Latin configurare. See configurate.

verbs.description: configure (third-person singular simple present configures, present participle configuring, simple past and past participle configured)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To set up or arrange something in such a way that it is ready for operation for a particular purpose, or to someone's particular liking
examples: Users may configure the settings to enhance their experience.
